cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 160 mi south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north toward the western Florida Panhandle today, then forecast to track inland across Alabama, Georgia, the southern Appalachians and eventually into the Mid-Atlantic states
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Florida Panhandle (near Panama City / Apalachicola)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch/Warning and Tropical-Storm Watch/Warning limited to the Florida Panhandle and Big Bend coast (Indian Pass to Yankeetown; Navarre to Wakulla/Jefferson County line)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Panhandle from Navarre to Wakulla/Jefferson County line (Tropical-Storm Warning); Indian Pass to Yankeetown (Storm Surge Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf Coast of Florida, then inland across AL, GA, the Carolinas and portions of the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None listed (probabilities <1% at all table sites nearest to New York)
weather_observation.wind: Only breezy conditions expected; sustained tropical-storm-force winds not anticipated
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the New York / New Jersey harbor area
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate to heavy rain (2–4 inches) possible Wednesday as remnant moisture interacts with a front
weather_observation.other_hazards: Localized urban and small-stream flooding could briefly disrupt port ground transportation
